data.title: Food was Ok service was confused
data.text:
I thought the food here was ok but nothing that made me want to come back. I had soup, a Thai Salad, Thai Sausages and an entree all were good but the order was messed up. I did get the soup first which was good but then the confusion came in. I got my salad and entree at the same time and then the sausage which was an appetizer came last. The wait staff seemed confused. 
If I was going to do this again I would go to the restaurant but unfortunately I don't think I would go again but not because of the food. Sorry.

data.title: Not bad
data.text: I ate here with a coworker for dinner.  We started with the chicken satay for an appetizer.  Nothing special.  I had the chicken Thai basil with rice ordered 'very spicy'.  I thought the chicken basil meal was really, really good.  My only complaint was it was a bit cold when they brought it out and I wish it had been a bit more spicy.  I thought the meal was pretty good overall and would happily go back.  A nice and clean restaurant.  Friendly enough service.  Overall a good experience.  I do wish that had fountain sofa, but cans are ok.  The prices were affordable ($10-$15 for most meals).  Soda was $1.50 a can.  As I said, I would go back!

data.title: Great Thai!
data.text: Great food.  Lunch specials that include appetizer and free soda (I skipped that) start at $9.  They will alter spice to taste.

data.title: Great Find
data.text: It's a little place but with big flavors.  We were greeted upon entering felt very welcomed.  The menu is simple.  We had the Tom yum soup, papaya salad, and chicken with basil.  Every dish was good.  The Tom yum soup was a little on the sour side but it was still good.  I think they are pretty authentic.  Service was excellent.  Will be coming back soon.

data.title: Went for Lunch Special
data.text: I came here with a friend for the lunch special. For Westchester County prices, $9 was a great deal for an appetizer, entree, and small soda. Both my friend and I started off with the spring roll appetizer. I thought the spring roll was going to be the kind in the clear wrapper, but it was just your typical fried roll with vegetables in it and came with duck sauce. I would recommend you order the soup or salad since they only give you one roll and I thought that was on the skimpy side. I would of preferred they offer two spring rolls each. Next, I ordered the green curry and it came with a side of jasmine rice. I thought the coconut broth was excellent and wasn't too spicy. The portions again I thought were a little bit on the small side. It was enough for me because I couldn't eat more than what they gave me, but maybe a grown man might need more to eat. My friend ordered the Thai fried rice with chicken and her portion was a little bigger than mine. Your meal also comes with soda, and I got diet coke. The server gave me a glass with ice and a soda can, which I felt was fair for a "small soda". Our server was also very attentive, but nothing special. Overall, this place made excellent food and I felt it was good for the price, but their portions were a tad small.

data.title: Great new spot
data.text:
After checking out a fairly new Thai restaurant I was pleasantly surprised by the great service and bright interior. It was a place I had passed many times but because of it's being on North Broadway parking was a concern.  After a quick check we were able to secure a spot not far from the restaurant. 
I noticed many neighborhood people were doing take out so it is convenient for many. 
The food was really tasty and very reasonable. I had the pad Thai which was pretty good and the prices were reasonable. Would recommend.

data.title: Thai
data.text: Thai, Thai and Thai. Birthday dinner. I see it has changed it's name but still the same as in prior years. Good.

data.title: Great service and tasty food
data.text: We were craving for Thai food on a Friday evening. Decided to try out this restaurant. Have been to Reka's which used to be at the same location before. The new ambience was casual and the tables were arranged spaciously. Went with wife and kids. Ordered pretty standard vegetarian appetizers - Fried Tofu and Spring rolls, they were tasty. For main course, ordered pad se eew, Thai fried rice and Thai spicy basil. Food was delicious, service was courteous and fast. Will definitely go back again.

data.title: Impressive Thai food in a cozy atmosphere
data.text: Had a nice meal here and felt as if I was back in Thailand.  The staff was friendly and quite attentive.  The food was tasty and filled me up.  Will be my go to spot for Thai Food in White Plains!

data.title: well presented food
data.text:
We went to I Thai for the first time and shared 3 meals, as well as appetizers. We were 3 people.

We started with one of their soups that was phenomenol. I can't recall the name, but it has coconut flavor, chicken and ginger. It was good to the last drop. We all tasted it. We also had 3 fried buns. I don't recall the name again, but they remind me of meat pies. They were small but fresh and very tasty

For the main course, we have crispy duck that had an amazing sauce, skirt steak which was very tasty and came with sticky rice. We also had Pad Thai with chicken. There was enough food to have leftovers.

We didn't get to desert, but they seemed to have a nice selection, such as fried ice cream, fried cheesecake and lots of other ice creams.

Overall, I would say the food was VERY fresh with fresh ingredients.

data.title: Tried to order delivery and failed
data.text: I had called Friday evening when I lived closed to this newly opened restaurant. I called them to order for delivery; the lady on the phone said my address is beyond their delivery reach. I lived 0.6 miles away from the restaurant. She said she will check with the manager. In the meantime I ordered from Baos and got the food delivered. So almost an hour later, she calls me to inform that they can deliver, after checking with her manager. Of course I said no but disappointed as I wanted to try the new restaurant but they lost a potential long-term customer.

data.title: Very tasty good food, fresh ingredients, perfect portion size
data.text: I love this new restaurant. The food tastes really phenomenal—I've tried several dishes and have yet to be let down. Everything always tastes fresh, which I like. I also particularly appreciate that they serve normal portions; I don't feel bad for cleaning my plate, and yet I go home with a full and satisfied stomach. Highly recommended!

data.title: Another great restaurant in the neighborhood!
data.text:
A member of our family that lives in Arlington, Va introduced us to Thai food while visiting. We had never tried this type of food before. We very much enjoyed our first tastes. We were pleasantly pleased to see a new Thai restaurant had opened in our neighborhood.This past Sunday we decided to try this new restaurant. My husband had the Chicken pineapple fried rice entree and I had the Chicken noodles PadTai entree. For starters we shared the chicken steamed dumpling appetizer. We really enjoyed it all. We had the same type of meal the first time in Va and wanted to compare tastes. And they were both 
delicious! 

The service was attentive and we expected this since we were the only people dining at this time. They haven't been opened very long and trying to get the word out. 

No liquor license yet but I believe you can BYO. But check with them first. 

The menu has many choices. If you choose one of the i-thad specials you can select your degree of spiciness (mild,medium or spicy) They also have lunch specials that comes with a choice of spring roll, Thai salad or house soup and a free soda. Offered 
Mon-Fri.

We will be back to try some more dishes that they offer, hope to see you there.

data.title: Great - fresh - amazing Thai food in White Plains
data.text: iThai is a great restaurant - to take out, or to eat there. The food is incredibly fresh, tastes amazing, and health-conscious. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for good Asian food. Service is fast, and the prices are very reasonable.

data.title: Good Taste , good ambience but smal portions
data.text: Visited the restaurant for lunch.  This is the new restaurant at the location that formerly housed Reeka's.  Ambience is good, feels bright and clean. Service was good but expected sice it was not crowded.  Luch special was good but portion was small.  The included free soda (which I have no use for and there's no substitution) help fills your stomach.
